intro: Triaspis glaucophylla, commonly known as the silver-leafed triaspis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, silvery-green leaves that give it its common name, and it produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or arid environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens for its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
